title: At the Top of a 40-Story Residential Tower in Singapore, Stands a Duplex Penthouse With Its Own Pool
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Beach Road, Singapore

Price: S$48 million (US$34.7 million)

This duplex penthouse stands atop the taller of the two Concourse Skyline residential towers and comes with its own private pool and rooftop garden.

The 11,130-square-foot apartment is on the 39th and 40th floors of the 40-story Beach Road building. It is being sold fully furnished with interiors by The I.D. Dept and exclusive furnishings and decor from more than 20 luxury brands, including Ermenegildo Zegna, De’Longhi and Leica.

The 360-unit Concourse Skyline was completed in 2014, but developer Hong Fok only recently released this penthouse for sale.

It has a "stunning, almost 360-degree panoramic view" of the Singapore skyline, said Sotheby’s Leong Boon Hoe.

More: Investors Can Still Capitalize as Demand Soars for ‘Undervalued’ Luxury Singapore Homes

The rooftop garden "is perfect for hosting outdoor parties at night or just drinking with friends while enjoying the beautiful night scene," he said.

One of the most striking custom pieces in the penthouse is luxury German brand Kaldewei’s free-standing Meisterstuck Soundwave bathtub in matte black, he said. The bathtub acts as a speaker, using a cutting-edge bath audio system that plays music when connected via Bluetooth to a smartphone, tablet or laptop.

The penthouse also boasts an exclusive made-to-order chandelier personally installed by the Paris-based glass artist Nathalie Ziegler, an elegant rocking chair by British-Israeli designer Ron Arad, and an exclusive installation by Lasvit, a Czech-based team of master craftsmen and manufacturer of lighting and glass installations, according to Sotheby’s.

Other luxury brands featured include the French brand de Gournay, famous for its hand-painted wallpaper and fabric; Devialet high-end speakers; and outdoor furniture from Belgian brand Tribu.

The artwork on display "can be purchased by the owner for a separate price if he or she wishes to own them," Mr. Boon Hoe said.

More: Singapore House Sells for S$230 Million, Latest in a String of Blockbuster Sales

The kitchen, which is on the lower level, "has been fitted with top-of-the-line products by De Dietrich," he said, including a pyrolytic oven and a "four-zone induction hob that comes with an intelligent cooking system."

The upper-level master bedroom suite "is big enough to fit a pair of king-sized beds" and includes his and hers walk-in wardrobes, he said. Just outside the master bedroom, there is an outdoor deck with a swimming pool and Jacuzzi, with views of the city skyline and Marina Bay.

Stats

The 11,130-square-foot apartment has five bedrooms and five full bathrooms.

Amenities

Concourse Skyline amenities include a 50-meter lap pool, a Jacuzzi and hot spa, a lounge, and a gym and clubhouse.

From Penta: Greubel Forsey Updates Tourbillon 30° Technique With Ceramic and Sapphire Crystal

Neighborhood Notes

"The Beach Road area was historically known as the ‘European Town’ in the colonial days," Mr. Boon Hoe said. "Much of the area was designated for use as living quarters by the European community."

For a long time, Beach Road was "lined with stretches of two-story shop houses and small office buildings," he said. "Today, this location is known for the exciting new developments that have sprouted up in the area."

It is located in close proximity to Singapore’s central business district, Mr. Boon Hoe added.

Agent: Leong Boon Hoe, chief operating officer, List Sotheby’s International Realty, Singapore
